critique: This executive order establishes the Global Engagement Center to counter terrorist messaging abroad. It revokes a previous order and outlines the center's responsibilities, including coordinating government communications, developing counterterrorism narratives, and engaging with various entities. It also establishes a steering committee and a temporary organization (GECCO) to support the center. The order emphasizes protecting national interests and freedom of expression. It directs agencies to provide support to the center. The order itself doesn't obviously lean strongly on any of the axes. It could be argued that focusing on counter-terrorism messaging leans towards national security, but it also mentions freedom of expression. The order seems fairly centrist and balanced.
